question:
What duties have been assigned to the National Commission for Women?
  1. To investigate and examine matters relating to the safeguards provided for women
  2. To recommend remedial legislative measures
  3. To evaluate the progress of the development of woman
  4. To make periodical reports to the Govt. on any matters pertaining women
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: All the above statements are correct. The National Commission for Women (NCW) is a statutory body constituted under the National Commission for Women Act, 1990 (No. 20 of 1990) on 31st January, 1992 with a view to protect, promote and safeguard the interests and rights of women.
